title: 105_hr2453
content: The "African-American Civil War Memorial Commemorative Coin Act" authorizes the minting of $1 silver coins in honor of African-American Civil War veterans. The coins will weigh 26.73 grams, have a diameter of 1.500 inches, and contain 90 percent silver and 10 percent copper. These coins will be legal tender and considered numismatic items. The Secretary will obtain silver for minting coins from stockpiles established under the Strategic and Critical Materials Stock Piling Act. The design of the coins will be determined under this Act. Design of coins minted under this Act shall be emblematic of the African-American Civil War Memorial, with specific inscriptions and designations. The design will be selected by the Secretary in consultation with relevant organizations and committees. SEC. 5. ISSUANCE OF COINS. Coins minted under this Act shall be issued in uncirculated and proof qualities at a designated Mint facility starting January 1, 2001, with minting authority ending on December 31, 2001. The Secretary will sell coins at a price including face value, surcharge, and design costs. Bulk sales will be discounted, and prepaid orders will receive a discount. A $10 surcharge per coin will be included in all sales. SEC. 7. GENERAL WAIVER OF PROCUREMENT REGULATIONS. No procurement laws apply to goods and services for this Act, except for equal employment opportunity laws. SEC. 8. DISTRIBUTION OF SURCHARGES. Surcharges from coin sales will be paid to the African-American Civil War Memorial Freedom Foundation for memorial support. The Comptroller General can audit the Foundation's expenditures. SEC. 9. FINANCIAL ASSURANCES. SEC. 9. FINANCIAL ASSURANCES. The Secretary must ensure no net cost to the Government for minting coins and require full payment, security, or guarantee for issued coins.
